Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: MTB strain 1254 Ctrl vs 0.5 mM DETA/NO 5min rep 4

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 3.8x SSC, 0.27% SDS) was sealed under a coverslip with rubber cement and hybridized overnight at 65 C for the DNA microarray. Oligonucleotide microarrays were first prehybridized for 1 h in 5x SSC, 1% BSA, and 0.1% SDS and washed with H2O and isopropanol. After the prehybridization, 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 2x SSC, 25% formamide, and 0.1% SDS) was hybridized overnight at 54 C.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Microarrays were scanned using a GenePix 4000A (Axon Instruments, Inc.). The intensities of the two dyes at each spot were quantified using ScanAlyze (M. Eisen, Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, Berkeley, CA).
Sample.Description: Simple annotation: Stress, Strain Comparison Image: http://smd.stanford.edu/MicroArray/gifs/2007-06/75590.gif
Sample.Data-Processing: VALUE is Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm)

Column.Name: ID_REF
Column.Description: ID_REF

Column.Name: CH1I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 1).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 2).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy5.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Contains median of Ch2PI-CH2B/Ch1PI-CH1B where Ch1PI & Ch2PI represent single pixel intensities.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: Count of the number of pixels in the spot.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: Number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: User defined spot flag (default 0).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: MTB strain 1254 Ctrl vs high aeration + 0.001 mM DETA/NO rep 3

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 3.8x SSC, 0.27% SDS) was sealed under a coverslip with rubber cement and hybridized overnight at 65 C for the DNA microarray. Oligonucleotide microarrays were first prehybridized for 1 h in 5x SSC, 1% BSA, and 0.1% SDS and washed with H2O and isopropanol. After the prehybridization, 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 2x SSC, 25% formamide, and 0.1% SDS) was hybridized overnight at 54 C.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Microarrays were scanned using a GenePix 4000A (Axon Instruments, Inc.). The intensities of the two dyes at each spot were quantified using ScanAlyze (M. Eisen, Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, Berkeley, CA).
Sample.Description: Simple annotation: Stress, Strain Comparison Image: http://smd.stanford.edu/MicroArray/gifs/2007-06/75622.gif
Sample.Data-Processing: VALUE is Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm)

Column.Name: ID_REF
Column.Description: ID_REF

Column.Name: CH1I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 1).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 2).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy5.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Contains median of Ch2PI-CH2B/Ch1PI-CH1B where Ch1PI & Ch2PI represent single pixel intensities.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: Count of the number of pixels in the spot.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: Number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: User defined spot flag (default 0).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: H37 Rv3132-34 KO 0 days vs Rv3132-34 KO (complemented) hypoxia 4 day rep 4

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 3.8x SSC, 0.27% SDS) was sealed under a coverslip with rubber cement and hybridized overnight at 65 C for the DNA microarray. Oligonucleotide microarrays were first prehybridized for 1 h in 5x SSC, 1% BSA, and 0.1% SDS and washed with H2O and isopropanol. After the prehybridization, 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 2x SSC, 25% formamide, and 0.1% SDS) was hybridized overnight at 54 C.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Microarrays were scanned using a GenePix 4000A (Axon Instruments, Inc.). The intensities of the two dyes at each spot were quantified using ScanAlyze (M. Eisen, Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, Berkeley, CA).
Sample.Description: Simple annotation: Stress, Strain Comparison Image: http://smd.stanford.edu/MicroArray/gifs/2007-06/75657.gif
Sample.Data-Processing: VALUE is Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm)

Column.Name: ID_REF
Column.Description: ID_REF

Column.Name: CH1I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 1).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 2).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy5.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Contains median of Ch2PI-CH2B/Ch1PI-CH1B where Ch1PI & Ch2PI represent single pixel intensities.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: Count of the number of pixels in the spot.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: Number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: User defined spot flag (default 0).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: MTB strain 1254 Ctrl vs 0.5 mM DETA/NO 8hrs rep 4

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 3.8x SSC, 0.27% SDS) was sealed under a coverslip with rubber cement and hybridized overnight at 65 C for the DNA microarray. Oligonucleotide microarrays were first prehybridized for 1 h in 5x SSC, 1% BSA, and 0.1% SDS and washed with H2O and isopropanol. After the prehybridization, 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 2x SSC, 25% formamide, and 0.1% SDS) was hybridized overnight at 54 C.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Microarrays were scanned using a GenePix 4000A (Axon Instruments, Inc.). The intensities of the two dyes at each spot were quantified using ScanAlyze (M. Eisen, Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, Berkeley, CA).
Sample.Description: Simple annotation: Stress, Strain Comparison Image: http://smd.stanford.edu/MicroArray/gifs/2007-06/75594.gif
Sample.Data-Processing: VALUE is Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm)

Column.Name: ID_REF
Column.Description: ID_REF

Column.Name: CH1I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 1).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 2).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy5.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Contains median of Ch2PI-CH2B/Ch1PI-CH1B where Ch1PI & Ch2PI represent single pixel intensities.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: Count of the number of pixels in the spot.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: Number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: User defined spot flag (default 0).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: H37Rv Ctrl vs 0.05 mM DETA/NO 40min rep 2

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 3.8x SSC, 0.27% SDS) was sealed under a coverslip with rubber cement and hybridized overnight at 65 C for the DNA microarray. Oligonucleotide microarrays were first prehybridized for 1 h in 5x SSC, 1% BSA, and 0.1% SDS and washed with H2O and isopropanol. After the prehybridization, 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 2x SSC, 25% formamide, and 0.1% SDS) was hybridized overnight at 54 C.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Microarrays were scanned using a GenePix 4000A (Axon Instruments, Inc.). The intensities of the two dyes at each spot were quantified using ScanAlyze (M. Eisen, Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, Berkeley, CA).
Sample.Description: Simple annotation: Stress, Strain Comparison Image: http://smd.stanford.edu/MicroArray/gifs/2001-08/19136.gif
Sample.Data-Processing: VALUE is Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm)

Column.Name: ID_REF
Column.Description: ID_REF

Column.Name: CH1I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2I_MEAN
Column.Description: Uncorrected Cy3 mean pixel intensity.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2B_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Median intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 1).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy3 Channel

Column.Name: CH2D_MEAN
Column.Description: The mean feature pixel intensity with the median background subtracted (channel 2).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH1B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy3.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: CH2B_MEAN
Column.Description: Mean intensities of background pixels of Cy5.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Background

Column.Name: PERGTBCH1I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 532 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PERGTBCH2I_1SD
Column.Description: The percentage of feature pixels with intensities more than one standard deviation above the background pixel intensity, at wavelength 635 nm.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: PIX_RAT2_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Contains median of Ch2PI-CH2B/Ch1PI-CH1B where Ch1PI & Ch2PI represent single pixel intensities.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_SPIX
Column.Description: Count of the number of pixels in the spot.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOT_BPIX
Column.Description: Number of background pixels.; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: REGR
Column.Description: The regression ratio of every pixel in a 2-feature-diameter circle around the center of the feature.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CORR
Column.Description: The correlation between channel1 (Cy3) & Channel 2 (Cy5) pixels within the spot, and is a useful quality control parameter. Generally, high values imply better fit & good spot quality.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: TOP
Column.Description: Box top: int(((centerX - radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: BOT
Column.Description: Box bottom: int(((centerX + radius) - Xoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: LEFT
Column.Description: Box left: int(((centerY - radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RIGHT
Column.Description: Box right: int(((centerY + radius) - yoffset) / pixelSize); Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: FLAG
Column.Description: User defined spot flag (default 0).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: CH2IN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity (CH2I_MEAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: CH2BN_MEDIAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of median Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) background (CH2B_MEDIAN/Normalization factor).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel; Background

Column.Name: CH2DN_MEAN
Column.Description: Normalized value of mean Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with normalized background subtracted (CH2IN_MEAN - CH2BN_MEDIAN).; Type: integer; Scale: linear_scale; Channel: Cy5 channel

Column.Name: RAT2N_MEAN
Column.Description: Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: RAT1N_MEAN
Column.Description: Ratio of the means of Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) intensity to normalized Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) intensity with median background subtracted (CH1D_MEAN/CH2DN_MEAN). Channel 1/Channel 2 ratio normalized or Green/Red ratio normalized.; Type: float; Scale: linear_scale

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Column.Description: Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm) [log (base 2) (RAT2N_MEAN)].; Type: float; Scale: log_base_2

Sample.Title: MTB strain 1254 Ctrl vs 0.05 mM DETA/NO 40min rep 1

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Channel.Source: Strain: MTB strain 1254 Treatment: 0.05 mM DETA/NO for 40min
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: Cell pellets were suspended in 1 ml TRIzol reagent (GIBCO BRL) and transferred to 2-ml screw cap tubes containing 0.5 ml 0.1-mm diameter zirconia/silica beads (BioSpec Products).
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Clinical isolate 1254, 7H9 medium (supplemented with BSA, NaCl, glucose, and glycerol), 250-ml vented tissue culture flasks, 90 rpm shaking, and a starting culture density of OD 0.15 were used, unless otherwise indicated. RNA samples isolated from OD 0.15 cultures of the M. tuberculosis strain being assayed on the same day were used for the reference sample in each experiment. Cells were collected with a 4-min centrifugation step and frozen on dry ice.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Cell debris was separated by a 45-s centrifugation. The supernatant was transferred to 2-ml Heavy Phase Lock Gel I tubes (Eppendorf) containing 300 ul chloroform, inverted rapidly for 15 s, and incubated 2 min. Samples were centrifuged for 5 min, and the aqueous phase was added to 270 ul isopropanol, followed by addition of 270 ul of the following mixture: 0.8 M sodium citrate and 1.2 M NaCl. Samples were incubated for 10 min at 4 C and centrifuged for 15 min at 4 C. The RNA pellets were washed with 1 ml 75% ethanol, centrifuged 5 min, and air-dried. After suspension of the RNA pellets in 90 ul water, 10 ul DNase I 10x buffer, and 6 U DNase I (Ambion) were added, and the samples were incubated for 30 min. Final purification of RNA was by RNeasy column (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: Both a PCR gene product microarray and a 70-mer oligonucleotide-based microarray (tuberculosis oligonucleotide set; QIAGEN) were used. Labeled cDNA was prepared as follows: 2 ug total RNA and 4.4ug of random oligonucleotide hexamers were incubated for 2 min at 98 C, cooled on ice, combined with Stratascript RTase buffer, 0.5 mM dA,G,CTP, 0.02 mM dTTP, 1.5 nmol Cy3 or Cy5-dUTP (Amersham Biosciences), and 1.8 ul Stratascript RTase (Stratagene) in a total volume of 25 ul, and incubated for 10 min at 25 C and 90 min at 42 C. cDNA was purified by microcon-10 (Amicon) filtration.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 3.8x SSC, 0.27% SDS) was sealed under a coverslip with rubber cement and hybridized overnight at 65 C for the DNA microarray. Oligonucleotide microarrays were first prehybridized for 1 h in 5x SSC, 1% BSA, and 0.1% SDS and washed with H2O and isopropanol. After the prehybridization, 10 ul of hybridization solution (labeled cDNA, 5 ug tRNA, 2x SSC, 25% formamide, and 0.1% SDS) was hybridized overnight at 54 C.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Microarrays were scanned using a GenePix 4000A (Axon Instruments, Inc.). The intensities of the two dyes at each spot were quantified using ScanAlyze (M. Eisen, Lawrence Berkeley National Lab, Berkeley, CA).
Sample.Description: Simple annotation: Stress, Stress by growth condition Image: http://smd.stanford.edu/MicroArray/gifs/2001-07/18438.gif
Sample.Data-Processing: VALUE is Log (base 2) of the ratio of the mean of Channel 2 (usually 635 nm) to Channel 1 (usually 532 nm)

Series.Title: Inhibition of Respiration by Nitric Oxide Induces a Mycobacterium tuberculosis Dormancy Program
Series.Summary: An estimated two billion persons are latently infected with Mycobacterium tuberculosis. The host factors that initiate and maintain this latent state and the mechanisms by which M. tuberculosis survives within latent lesions are compelling but unanswered questions. One such host factor may be nitric oxide (NO), a product of activated macrophages that exhibits antimycobacterial properties. Evidence for the possible significance of NO comes from murine models of tuberculosis showing progressive infection in animals unable to produce the inducible isoform of NO synthase and in animals treated with a NO synthase inhibitor. Here, we show that O2 and low, nontoxic concentrations of NO competitively modulate the expression of a 48-gene regulon, which is expressed in vivo and prepares bacilli for survival during long periods of in vitro dormancy. NO was found to reversibly inhibit aerobic respiration and growth. A heme-containing enzyme, possibly the terminal oxidase in the respiratory pathway, likely senses and integrates NO and O2 levels and signals the regulon. These data lead to a model postulating that, within granulomas, inhibition of respiration by NO production and O2 limitation constrains M. tuberculosis replication rates in persons with latent tuberculosis.
Series.Overall-Design: The quality controls were biological replicate and technical replicate
